heading: passage: elliott richardson, 79
subheading: the only person ever to hold four cabinet posts, richardson will be remembered as the man who defied president nixon by refusing to fire the special prosecutor in the watergate case. richardson, who accepted the position of attorney general at the height of the watergate scandal with the stipulation that archibald cox be given a free hand, resigned rather than carry out the order to fire him. richardson was later appointed ambassador to britain by president ford.
author: wired staff
text: the only person ever to hold four cabinet posts, richardson will be remembered as the man who defied president nixon by refusing to fire the special prosecutor in the watergate case. richardson, who accepted the position of attorney general at the height of the watergate scandal with the stipulation that archibald cox be given a free hand, resigned rather than carry out the order to fire him. richardson was later appointed ambassador to britain by president ford.
